_description: A poem by Henry Baradoun (fl. 1483) — six 8-line stanzas

RylandsEng113.First Lines:
MUsyng alone voide of consolacionDrowned in sorowe sighyng wondre
                    soreI may complayn with deedly lamentacionMy tyme evill spent sith
                    first I was bore…
RylandsEng113.Last Lines:
…Myght haue full weele but ȝhit folissh wilfulnesDoth
                    bynde ffowys prentise to wrecchidnes and woo
RylandsEng113.Attributed Author:
Baradoun henricus transtulit istud opus pro semetipsum (f.
                    4)
RylandsEng113.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             Political, Religious and Love Poems, from Lambeth MS. 306 and other
                sources.
EETS
         o.s. 15 (1866); repr. 1962; rev. ed. 1903: rev. ed. 289.
